Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jenesaisfckall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the third time recently, and again found the hotel to be excellent value for money. The room was a reasonable size, the beds comfortable, and everything was clean. The breakfast was spectacularly large and freshly cooked. A couple of minor quibbles: coffee was served from vacuum flasks, which meant that it was thoroughly stewed by the time we got to it; and here and there the building was fraying around the edges a little. However, the hotel is apparently about to close for renovations, which will no doubt remedy the latter issue. It's to be hoped that the refurbed hotel won't have higher prices though!

Reviews.Title: “A definite improvement!”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit - the first being about 2 years ago and not particularly memorable - I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised! The hotel seems to be undergoing some improvements, there is a new manager, new staff, and comfortable new beds. The English breakfast (which I remember was the best thing about my previous stay) is still good. Still a bit of a way to go - there were some creaks in the night, but nothing major. Useful location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Pretty Good.”
Reviews.Author: BaldEagleHarrogate
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel. On the face of it recently had a facelift. Water seemed to be pumped up from somewhere and during the night the pump could be heard but only when adjacent rooms used the taps. I am a light sleeper and was aware of it but it was not a real problem. Room was average size. Shower room was good. Breakfast was good. Staff pleasant. Got a car park.

Reviews.Title: “Noise from the boiler, cardboard walls and tin can windows makes sleep impossible!”
Reviews.Author: beakeypower_79
Reviews.Content: Very similar story to the last review. We stayed here while my wife was in the highgate hospital. The only reason we booked in to the hotel was to get some sleep for the 3 hour drive home the next day as I didnt fancy driving all that way without a decent nights sleep in the chair next to her bed. Total waste of money ! We booked 2 single rooms which were both small but functional and a fair reflection of the price. I stayed in room 8 and my mother in law just down the hall. In the cavity wall behind the head board of my head was a noisy part of the plumbing/boiler that loudly rumbled everytime a tap was put on. (constantly all night). It's about as loud as a car engine at idle. I was so tired and in bed I put in my headphones for earplugs and tried to get to sleep. Tossed and turned until 03:55 when 2 guys and a girl checked in to the room next door. They were loud but not so much so that it would have been an issue were it not for the fact the walls appear to be made of card they are so thin. This went on for about 45 mins - 1 hour. Then the traffic starts, The old aluminum windows are so useless you might as well be sat in the road it is so noisy. When I met my mother in Law for breakfat (which was quite good) I discovered that her stay was no better and we were both exhausted and had got a couple of hours sleep each. I honestly would have beenbbetter off sleeping in the car. We complained in the morning. I'm not expecting much for the money only that it is clean and that I get a good nights sleep, simple. It is clean to be fair, but don't bother coming here for sleep. At first they acted supprised and claimed never to have heard any noise. however as I persisted this turned to "must be the boiler above one of the rooms again" to "we keep telling the owner it needs to get sorted" to find that exactly the same thing is already on here proves they know all about these issues and just chance it. They also seemed to think I was reponsible for the noise for not getting dressed at 4 in the morning and confronting the drunk guys next door. (this place is all about service)! Exhausted, tired and gumpy I flat refused to pay the bill in full and eventually after great protest we agreed on £75 for both rooms instead of the £110. I was too tired to argue further. The lady on recepton took my number and said she would get the owner/manager to give me a call the next day. I have waited 3-4 days and no one has bothered. If they had just called and appologised I wouldn't have been bothered to log on here and register my dissatisfation. They didn't, so I did !

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation in Muswell Hill”
Reviews.Author: Grecofan2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in order to attend a family party in Highgate. Our double room was actually a good sized family room with bunk beds and a double bed. The ensuite shower room was clean and modern. An unexpected bonus was secure on-site parking. The hotel is well-run and the staff professional and friendly. The decor is neutral, the bed was comfortable and the cooked breakfast of excellent quality. It is a two minute walk to the shops of Muswell Hill and on a bus route/convenient for the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value B&B”
Reviews.Author: LandBli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in february 2011 with my husband. We had an ensuite room - was very clean and not as small as we were expecting for such a good value B&B. The man on reception wasnt there when we arrived, we had to ring the buzzer and wait for him to come up to reception. We found him very friendly and funny, although I can possibly see how people would take him the wrong way. Breakfast was good and included in the price of the room which is a bargain. Lots of choice. Overall I would recommend this hotel for sure. Really very pleased with our stay, more than comfortable and was very clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: heathersun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night and it was very cheerful. The room was quite basic but very clean! There was a TV and a great power shower. The breakfast on the morning was very tasty. The staff on the reception were friendly but in the morning, the kitchen staff seemed to be a bit rude or maybe it was just a bad morning for them. A great hotel to stay in for a few nights and easy to get into the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “Grumpy staff”
Reviews.Author: 5Tim5
Reviews.Content: I received a phone call on my mobile two hours before arriving to check that I was still planning to stay. So I assumed that the would be someone on reception when I finally got there. However the reception was locked and there were a number of people waiting in the foyer. The man who finally turned up on the reception was wearing a food stained tee shirt and was in a very bad mood. I couldn't really understand what had triggered his moodiness. I had had a long journey and to be greeted by such an unpleasant men was very bad. I wouldn't recommend this place if you paid me to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: explorer04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights.Homely setting.Reception staff were very friendly.Had to change rooms due to noise of buses at front of hotel.There was no problem doing this.Very good breakfast and very clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: llwchwr
Reviews.Content: Cheap & cheerful hotel for an overnight stay. Rooms are small( but how much space do you need) Try & get a room at the back if possible - noisy traffic never seems to stop & no double glazing Great breakfasts served by friendly staff Secure parking is a real bonus in London but if you don't need the car plenty of buses or you can always walk.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Tired”
Reviews.Author: AlvinTArdvark
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and it is getting very tired, The last refurbishment was of poor quality and done on the very cheap, paint work is like textured paint. Dirt collects in the corners due to the very poor finish. Mirrors in every room I stayed in are OK if you are 5â€™4â€� but at over six foot I can only shave my navel unless I kneel down. Some rooms have holes in the ceilings where damp has got in and paint flaking off the ceilings. TVâ€™s are old 14â€� portable and of very poor quality. Staff are the hotels only asset as it is obvious that the owner wonâ€™t spend any money on maintaining the rooms. OK to stay at if you donâ€™t want luxury as it is clean and tidy despite the lack of maintenance and the breakfast is of excellent quality, Free range eggs and proper butchers sausages not the usual rubbish served in most places, Mushrooms would be a nice addition

Reviews.Title: “A bit quirky but ok”
Reviews.Author: housered
Reviews.Content: This place really is OK, the manager chappy is a bit of an eccentric (the owners are not apparent) but that was quite fun. Parking is off road and very secure. Rooms are fairly basic with flatpack furniture but what do you expect at this price? Reception is well furnished and welcoming, late access is via key. Breakfasts in the basement are lively and well vitalled. We are returning in July so hope it is still up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Muswell Hill Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelmissives
Reviews.Content: Pleasant enough if you can book. However, it can be tricky obtaining an answer via phone in the afternoon, so best try them in the morning. Otherwise, staff very helpful and considerate. Traditional cooked breakfast is huge and very satisfying. Opposite Cranley Gardens, where Denis Neilson did his dark deeds many years ago. Handy for Muswell Hill Broadway. Parking to the rear.

HotelInfo.Name: Muswell Hill Guest House
HotelInfo.Address: 73 Muswell Hill Rd, London N10 3HT, England
